intro: Spilanthes poliolepidica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false mustard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Spilanthes poliolepidica is also known for its peppery scent and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
